Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2009 03:55PM dixie46 wrote: I am praying so hard for your "Sweet Pea"  I was simply speechless when I saw this post.  I don't think there is anyone here who would not for a second wish they could go thru this for her.  There is nothing more unfair than any child getting any cancer.  My stepson had lukemia at 15 and is now 39 and doing fine but I know how devestating something like this can be and unbelievable at only 10. My prayers will be continual for this little girl's journey and special prayers for you the family.
Posts.Title: HELP! 10 year old with bc cjsocal Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: dixie46 wrote: I was operated on 7-9 on left breast.  Had right removed on 3-31.  Went to doctor yesterday and he removed one of the drains.  When I stripped the drain and measured last night at 9:00pm everything seemed fine but when I woke up this morning it does not seem to be draining at all. Called surgeon and he said to watch it today and if still not draining come in early tomorrow.  I just wondered if anyone here ever had that happen and what did they do about it.
